attachments.displayName:
Poem submitted by Joanne Coyle - The Magic of Oakfield park
Under an envelope of engine smoke the Earl of Oakfield arrives at the station.
Beyond the clouds Croaghan mountain dust's the distance.
A timeless tower of trees touch the sky.
Swans sit on the clear reflection of the castle.
Bird song breathes in the air around the boat house.
Petals paint the path's.
A figment of ferries flutter beneath the faerie tree.
A nymphaeum nests on the lake, a serene sanctuary where water flows free.
The perfectly patterned parterre is trimmed with oak trees.
Pets sleep silently in pet cemetery.
A stream of stepping stones brings the bloom of bluebell woods.
Secret statues stare.
Branches bend backwards in to the arms of Aprils tree.
The deanery shadows stunning scenery.
Still the Duchess of Difflin dances around winding woods, her steam surrounding Heathers point.

Found at http://dch.ie/1bbcZF0
